originalQuiz.topic: 2025 Los Angeles Immigration Protests and Federal Troop Deployment
originalQuiz.issue: Federal deployment of National Guard/Marines during LA immigration protests sparks constitutional debate
originalQuiz.description: This quiz examines the 2025 LA protests against immigration enforcement and subsequent deployment of federal troops, exploring tensions between federal authority (10th Amendment), state autonomy, and citizens' rights to protest. It connects current events to constitutional principles of federalism, civil liberties, and civic participation in democracy.

questions.question: How many active-duty Marines were deployed to Los Angeles in June 2025?
questions.hint: This number was specifically mentioned in coverage about military deployment disagreements
questions.explanation: The deployment of 700 Marines demonstrated federal executive power under Article II of the Constitution, though state officials argued this violated principles of federalism.

sources.name: Division, distrust roil L.A. as federal troops arrive - LA Times

questions.question: Which constitutional principle did California officials cite when opposing federal troop deployment?
questions.hint: This amendment deals with powers reserved to states
questions.explanation: The Tenth Amendment reserves non-delegated powers to states, creating ongoing debates about federal intervention in local law enforcement matters.

questions.question: Protesters successfully shut down the 101 Freeway during the June 2025 demonstrations.
questions.hint: Look for information about protest locations and police responses
questions.explanation: The 101 Freeway shutdown demonstrated both the scale of protests and challenges in balancing public safety with protest rights under the First Amendment.

sources.name: Anti-ICE protests enter fourth night - CBS News

questions.question: How might the federal deployment of troops impact community trust in local law enforcement?
questions.correctAnswer: Answers should address: Reduced trust due to perceived federal overreach, strained local-federal coordination, or increased tensions between communities and authorities
questions.hint: Consider both immediate effects and long-term relationships
questions.explanation: When federal forces operate without local coordination, it can undermine community policing efforts and deter civic participation in public safety matters.
